alert.note: Alert for Clark; Jackson (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 11:51PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Clark and central Jackson Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1151 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hatfield, or 9 miles southwest of Neillsville, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hatfield around 1200 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Ballard Road And Pray Avenue, East Fork Campground, The Black River Correctional Center, Bruce Mound, Lake Arbutus, Seventeen Flowage, Pray, Lake Wazee and Merrillan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
